summary: Before a drug can be marketed in the United States, the FDA must determine it is safe and effective. The company or entity seeking to market the drug must submit evidence for review. FDA’s goal is to complete 90% of these reviews within deadlines that vary depending on the drug. Some drugs—ones that may provide significant improvement over what’s available—receive priority designations for expedited reviews...
title: FDA Drug Approval: Application Review Times Largely Reflect FDA Goals
